Posts.Content: Maisie101 wrote: I am 39 years old and about a year ago I suddenly developed a stinging pain in my left breast and armpit.  I went to my GP (I am in UK) a few times and I was eventually referred to Breast Clinic where I was examined and given a mamogram.  I was told that I had fibrocystic breasts, however I had read that this usually affected both breasts and was cyclical.  I have tracked my pain for about 8 months and whilst it does come and go there doesn't seem to be any pattern related to my cycle and I have never had any pain in the other breast. 2 days ago I noticed a red spot on the left breast (about 4 o'clock position).  It looks like a pimple or insect bit, is about 0.75cm diameter and slightly raised.  Having read about IBC this rasied some alarm bells with me and now I am starting to panic.  The pain is very bad at the moment (ranging from about 10 o'clock to 4 o'clock and in the armpit) and although it feels swollen / heavy to me, my mum has just checked and assured me there is no difference in size / feeling between the 2 breasts. Over the last year I have spoken to a fnumber of doctors about it and they all tell everything is fine and telll me to take painkillers.  There are not willing to refer me back to Brest Clinic as they are happy with the fribrocystic breast diagnosis.  Am I being paranoid or should I be pushing for more tests? I would be really grateful for any advice?  Many thanks.  Maisie x Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Could it be IBC? Maisie101 Maisie101

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2012 10:23AM Maisie101 wrote: Many thanks everyone for your comments.  I was worried about wasting doctor's time, but you have convinced that I should push the doctor for another referral.  Thanks.
Posts.Title: Could it be IBC? Maisie101 Maisie101
